resources.string:
\tThis is a trivia quiz about historical events, as depicted on US postage stamps, that occurred in the state of Massachusetts in the United States.\n
\tAfter each question, select the button next to the answer you think is correct; then click the Total Score button at the end to have your score displayed in a pop-up message.\n
\tIf you like, you can enter your name in the field below, and it will be displayed with your score at the end of the quiz.\n
\tThe check box exists to comply with project rubric \-\- functionally, it has nothing to do with the quiz, and is there for your gratification and amusement.
Enter your name, if you like
In what Massachusetts factory city did Jan Matzeliger develop his shoe-lasting machine that transformed the shoe industry?
Emily Dickinson was born and died in what western Massachusetts college town?
Robert Goddard successfully tested the first liquid-fueled rocket in Auburn, Massachusetts in what year?
Martin Luther King received his doctorate in theology from what Boston area university?
Dr. Seuss (Theodore Geisel) was born in 1904 in what Massachusetts city?
In 1636, following his exile from Massachusetts, Roger Williams founded a new colony on Narragansett Bay that woiuld become Rhode Island. Why was he kicked out of Massachusetts?
What is the building pictured on this stamp celebrating the bicentennial of Massachusetts statehood?
The USS Constitution - the oldest commissioned ship in the US Navy - is stationed at the Charlestown Navy Yard in Boston. She fought her most notable actions during which war?
